info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 01 at 7:34PM CDT until August 02 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MCLEAN AND MERCER COUNTIES... At 734 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hazen Bay Recreation Area, or 16 miles north of Beulah, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Stanton around 805 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include White Shield, Fort Stevenson State Park, Indian Hills State Recreation Area, Dakota Waters Recreation Area, Emmet and Lake Sakakawea State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
